page.title: 05DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Blackpool owed its development from a tiny fishing village at the beginning of the 19th Century to a large seaside resort of approximately 150,000 people to the working classes of the industdrial North and Midlands. Brought by the cheap railways, Blackpool provided a cheap holiday. Today Blackpool still provides cheap holidays, with a terrific variety of things to do even if the weather is inclement. The famous Tower, Illuminations and trams continue to make it a unique resort and its season continues nearly two months after most other resorts have closed down for the winter. It also continues to cater for political and business conferences throughout the year.
